parent_formation: Eastern Air Command, RAF (Operation Torch forces)

commander.name: Don Carlson
commander.notes: New Zealander. 4 victories with 74 Squadron in 1941, 5 victories with 154 Squadron in North Africa (including Ju 88 on 15 November 1942)

operations_history.notes: Squadron Leader Don Carlson shot down Ju 88 bomber
Flying Officer 'Paddy' Chambers shot down 4 of 5 Italian SM.79 aircraft intercepted

sources: History of War: No. 154 Squadron (RAF) during the Second World War (historyofwar.org)

metadata.notes: Good Tier 2 source corroboration for unit designation, commander, aircraft variants, operational dates, and specific combat actions. Limited data on exact personnel strength (estimated from standard RAF establishment). Squadron became operational 24 February 1942, participated in Dieppe raid, then deployed to North Africa for Operation Torch in November 1942. Operated Spitfire VA/VB from February 1942-January 1943. Notable actions include Chambers' quadruple SM.79 victory on 28 November 1942. First two weeks: 19 Luftwaffe bombers claimed destroyed, 9 damaged.
